channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old television flytipped in garden of Barset Sheltered Housing Unit., 18th September
item.description:
The old television flytipped in the garden of Barset Sheltered Housing Unit has obviously been there for a long time because plants have grown over it.

item.title: Anerley park covered in filth, 18th September
item.description:
Anerley park hasn’t been cleaned in weeks. Same spots as always eg outside linden park where there are literal rats running around on the pavement. Several dog poos and Flytipped rubbish. The whole road is a disgrace - please can you get it cleaned up asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failed dustbin collection, 18th September
item.description:
General household bins were not emptied on Crown Lane. The excuse given on Bromley’s website is access issues. Firstly, the food waste and the paper/card bins were emptied yesterday without issue so the claim of access problems is questioned. Secondly, notwithstanding the first point, the vast number of drivers congregating outside Coopers School every day is causing congestion by ignoring double yellow lines, blocking access and parking across junctions. Why isn’t Bromley Council joined up on this matter? If Bromley’s waste management team regularly incurs access problems in the same area, why isn’t Bromley traffic management team sending out wardens and marshalls to resolve the issue?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Double divan bed fly tipped next to my house, 18th September
item.description:
A double divan bed has been dumped on the pavement next to my house. It has been propped against my fence, and could cause problems if it falls. It was not there last night when I got home from work at 4pm, but was there this morning when I left at 7:30am.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shakespeare Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chaotic inconsiderate parking, 18th September
item.description:
Monday to Friday between 14:30 and 16:00 high numbers of drivers park up directly outside Coopers School causing terrible congestion. Parking is out of control and becoming dangerous - no consideration is given to double yellow lines, access points or other parking measures. Vehicles are parked across junctions and on grass verges. There is no control or marshalls by Coopers. This inconsiderate and unregulated behaviour is having repercussions on residents for example the dustbins weren’t collected yesterday as the dustcart couldn’t get through. This also means emergency service vehicles wouldn’t be able to get through if needed. Seeing as how Coopers School have no interest in advising their parents not to do this and are not bothering to send out traffic marshall’s it falls to either the Council to send out Traffic Wardens every afternoon or the Police to clamp down on this antisocial behaviour and begin issuing fines for illegal parking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin man didn’t take rest of the rubbish bin, 18th September
item.description:
Bin man only took some of the rubbish and left the rest, I don’t know if his new but usually they make sure all the rubbish bin is collected, this is now going to create more mess in the street when the fox goes through it. Please do something about it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nevill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
